etymologies: mid 19th century. From scientific Latin siderosis from ancient Greek σίδηρος iron + scientific Latin -osis

definitions: A form of pneumoconiosis resulting from the chronic inhalation of dust or fumes containing iron.
Excessive accumulation of haemosiderin in organs and tissues of the body; = "haemosiderosis".
Accumulation of iron in parts of the eye, especially the lens, iris, and retina, typically as the result of the presence of a ferrous foreign body.
